commit_message:
Cinder client reset-state improvements

Now we can use 'cinder reset-state' command for 'volume',
'snapshot', 'backup', 'group' and 'group-snapshot'.
Also change volume's default status from 'available' to
'None' when not any status is specified.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I0aefeaf5ece74f1f2bc4b72d5705c8c088921e20
Partial-implements: blueprint client-reset-state-improvements

subject: VMAX driver - Manage/Unmanage performance fix
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-12 12:52:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/b01410325eeabba2375ca7592633208a2ca634a2', 'message': 'VMAX driver - Manage/Unmanage performance fix

Previously managing an existing volume made a call to the ECOM
server which retrieved every volume across all connected arrays.
When this call was made if there were heavily populated arrays
the call would hang and eventually crash. To get around this,
instead of seeking the volume at the start of the manage operation,
the relevant details are filled in to a CIMInstanceName object and
this object is used for a more directed search to the ECOM server,
returning the volume successfully if it exists.

Change-Id: Ib8a628016caf88f67ec54ce10bc735053b70c8c2
Closes-Bug: #1681888

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Manage/Unmanage performance fix

Previously managing an existing volume made a call to the ECOM
server which retrieved every volume across all connected arrays.
When this call was made if there were heavily populated arrays
the call would hang and eventually crash. To get around this,
instead of seeking the volume at the start of the manage operation,
the relevant details are filled in to a CIMInstanceName object and
this object is used for a more directed search to the ECOM server,
returning the volume successfully if it exists.

Change-Id: Ib8a628016caf88f67ec54ce10bc735053b70c8c2
Closes-Bug: #1681888

subject: [Trivial] SMBFS: fix passing image format using volume types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 10:14:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/windows/smbfs.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/windows/test_smbfs.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/ed643d1ff79b9c589bb4eb69455f16ba1f52aca1', 'message': "[Trivial] SMBFS: fix passing image format using volume types

The SMBFS driver accepted specifying the image format via volume
type extra specs. The main reason was that those images were supposed
to work with Hyper-V as well as KVM (which does not apply anymore).

A previous change broke this feature, always expecting the volume
extra specs key to be 'volume_format', without considering scopes
(which are required in this case).

At the moment, this feature may still be useful, for example opting
for vhd images for compatibility reasons. Also, we're considering
adding VHDSet format support, which may be requested through volume
type extra specs.

This change fixes this issue by checking the extra specs using the
'smbfs' scope.

Closes-Bug: #1690779

Change-Id: Iab6c7792a7611aea9db4b412c676e32d3370b13e
"}]
commit_message:
[Trivial] SMBFS: fix passing image format using volume types

The SMBFS driver accepted specifying the image format via volume
type extra specs. The main reason was that those images were supposed
to work with Hyper-V as well as KVM (which does not apply anymore).

A previous change broke this feature, always expecting the volume
extra specs key to be 'volume_format', without considering scopes
(which are required in this case).

At the moment, this feature may still be useful, for example opting
for vhd images for compatibility reasons. Also, we're considering
adding VHDSet format support, which may be requested through volume
type extra specs.

This change fixes this issue by checking the extra specs using the
'smbfs' scope.

Closes-Bug: #1690779

Change-Id: Iab6c7792a7611aea9db4b412c676e32d3370b13e

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I0dcc1b8e9f0dd51b6892126a2ef010e6f3a2d940

commit_message:
Make quota-class working better

Add three new quota API for admin to handle the quotas for projects,
new API allows the admin to create a typecal quota class, and use
this quota class to create or update an tenant's quotas quickly.

Change-Id: I936e33cc4eac301d22c0fdbb09c87da0042f9882
Implements: blueprint quota-class
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/30/355430/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== We can make quota-class working better ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/quota-class Only the "default" quota class can be used in cinder right now, if admin user want to change the quota of a project, he need to input the keys and values (volumes, snapshots, gigabytes, backups, backup-gigabytes, consistencygroups, volume-type, per-volume-gigabytes) one by one, it's inefficient,so we need a model class which can apply to a projrct, new api will be added to cinder-api. Problem description =================== The follow cmd maybe used if admin want to create or update the quotas for a project. `cinder quota-update ce6e5348db75430d8dd37acd709a2866 \ --volumes 10 --snapshots 10 --gigabytes 100 --backups 10 --backup-gigabytes 100 --consistencygroups 10 --volume-type lvm --per-volume-gigabytes 10` It's ok if only one project to create or update, it's a disaster to admin if there are many projects to handle, everyone wants to improve efficiency about this operation. Use Cases ========= It's most useful for the admin of the cloud, three operations provided as follow: * Allows the admin to create a typecal quota class, and use this quota class to create or update an tenant's quotas quickly. * Update an exist quota class. * Delete a quota class Proposed change =============== Add three quota-api for admin to handle the quotas for projects, * cinder quota-class-create <class_name> <options> the admin can use cmd to create a quota class, for example: `cinder quota-class-create VIP \ --volumes 10 --snapshots 10 --gigabytes 100 --backups 10 --backup-gigabytes 100 --consistencygroups 10 --volume-type lvm --per-volume-gigabytes 10` * cinder quota-class-apply <class_name> <project_id> then use cmd to apply the VIP quota class to projects, for example: `cinder quota-class-apply VIP project_1 project_2` It's ok if admin input more then one peojects. * cinder quota-class-delete <class_name> if the VIP quota become useless, admin can delete it by the cmd quota-class-delete, for example: `cinder quota-class-delete ce6e5348db75430d8dd37acd709a2866` It's ok if admin input more then one quota classes. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- Do not need to add new keys to cinder database, so no database migration, but some tables will be changed as the cmd runing, for example: * cinder quota-class-create <class_name> <options> Add new columns to quota_classes, +---------------------+---------+----+------------+-----------+------------+ | created_at | deleted | id | class_name | resource | hard_limit | +---------------------+---------+----+------------+-----------+------------+ | 2016-05-16 16:03:46 | 0 | 1 | class_name | volumes | 10 | | 2016-05-16 16:03:46 | 0 | 2 | class_name | snapshots | 10 | | 2016-05-16 16:03:46 | 0 | 3 | class_name | gigabytes | 100 | | 2016-05-16 16:03:48 | 0 | 4 | class_name | backups | 10 | +---------------------+---------+----+------------+-----------+------------+ * cinder quota-class-apply <class_name> <project_id> Some columns will be changed in table quotas as class in table quota_classes, +----+------------...+------------+-----------+------------+-----------+ | id | created_at ...| project_id | resource | hard_limit | allocated | +----+------------...+------------+-----------+------------+-----------+ | 1 | created_at ...| project_id | gigabytes | 100 | 0 | | 2 | created_at ...| project_id | backups | 10 | 0 | | 3 | created_at ...| project_id | snapshots | 10 | 0 | | 4 | created_at ...| project_id | volumes | 10 | 0 | +----+------------...+------------+-----------+------------+-----------+ Now some resource will not add to table quotas when use cmd quota-update without change resource's hard_limit, but this will be changed in this bp, all resource hard_limit will copy to table quotas. * cinder quota-class-delete <class_name> Set "deleted" to non-zero of a class in table quota_classes. +---------------------+---------+----+------------+-----------+------------+ | created_at | deleted | id | class_name | resource | hard_limit | +---------------------+---------+----+------------+-----------+------------+ | 2016-05-16 16:03:46 | 1 | 1 | class_name | volumes | 10 | | 2016-05-16 16:03:46 | 1 | 2 | class_name | snapshots | 10 | | 2016-05-16 16:03:46 | 1 | 3 | class_name | gigabytes | 100 | | 2016-05-16 16:03:48 | 1 | 4 | class_name | backups | 10 | +---------------------+---------+----+------------+-----------+------------+ REST API impact --------------- Add the following ADPIs. * Create quota-class * V2/<tenant_id>/os-quota-class-sets * Method: POST * Send JSON schema definition for V2:: { "class_name": "VIP_quota", "volumes": 10, "snapshots": 10, "gigabytes": 100, ...... } * Apply quota-class * V2/<tenant_id>/os-quota-class-sets/apply * MEthod: GET * JSON schema definition for V2:: { "class_name": "VIP_quota", "project_id": "ce6e5348db75430d8dd37acd709a2866", ...... } * Delete quota-class * V2/<tenant_id>/os-quota-class-sets * MEthod: DELETE * JSON schema definition for V2:: { "class_name": "VIP_quota", ...... } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- New cmd can be used in cinderclient, * cinder quota-class-create <class_name> <options> * cinder quota-class-apply <class_name> <project_id> * cinder quota-class-update <class_name> <options> * cinder quota-class-delete <class_name> Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Wenjun Wang Other contributors: Dongsheng Yang Work Items ---------- * Implement quota-class-create * Implement quota-class-apply * Implement quota-class-update * Implement quota-class-delete * Implement changes for python-cinderclient * Cinder Doc changes Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Both unit and Tempest tests are needed to be created to cover the API change. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Support multiple nova consuming one cinder

Sometimes it is desirable to have more than one consumer (e.g.
a nova instance) talking to a single cinder instance. This
currently only mostly works, since there are some cinder APIs
that call back to the nova API (assisted snapshots, locality
filter, retype/migrate of attached volumes).

This spec describes a potential fix.

API-Impact
Change-Id: I0220b6c6381a9519eae46d2f8b08c009bf2e1bf7
Depends-On: Ibddabbc9b2e61b2c1cab878881c4d37e3a13a6e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/37/362637/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================================== Support multiple consumers to a single Cinder service ===================================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/cinder-multi-nova There are some situations where a single Cinder instance may have multiple consumers (more than one nova instance talking to it, or nova + some external consumer). This mostly works fine, but there are some corner cases that require a simple API change to solve. For convenience, this spec will refer to multiple nova consumers, although it is not actually limited to that - some other consumer can implement the nova callback API and it would be equivilent. Problem description =================== If Cinder has more than one consumer, then the small number of functions that cause cinder to call nova (file backed device snapshot, live migration, live retype) are broken, since you can only have one nova endpoint in cinder.conf / the catalogue, and Cinder has no idea which nova to call. Use Cases ========= A deployer wants to use one cinder instance as a block storage provider to more than one nova, or to one nova and some other ocnsumer (ironic, bare metal, VMWare, whatever) Proposed change =============== Cinder can accept an (optional) endpoint URL at attach time, and use that for all communication back to nova. This would need to be persisted in the DB. Alternatives ------------ None so far considered Data model impact ----------------- REST API impact --------------- The attach API would take an optional additional parameter, APIURL. Details of schema will be added if there's general agreement with the idea of the feature. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- Attach notification would have the additional info added Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- To take advantage of this feature, nova would have to be configured to pass the appropriate URL in to cinder. I don't see any downside with this becoming the default long-term. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Duncan Thomas <duncan.thomas@gmail.com> Other contributors: Scott D'Angello Work Items ---------- - cinder side implementation - python-cinderclient integration - nova integration Dependencies ============ Change-Id: Ibddabbc9b2e61b2c1cab878881c4d37e3a13a6e7 is an update to the attach API which should probably be done first. The URL parameter could be added to the old and new attach APIs, or just the new Testing ======= Unit tests as appropriate. Functional test to ensure that if the parameter is supplied, it is subsequently used for callback based functions. Documentation Impact ==================== API ref will need updating. Probably some notes on how and when to configure this on the nova side. References ========== None

commit_message:
Enhance error messages for API user

This spec is intended to enhance error message according to
the guideline [1].
Formatted and consistent messages with better quality will
help users and developer learn the API quickly and enjoy
using the API.

DocImpact
APIImpact

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167793/

Change-Id: Icb0927a0460eb2888469cae0130602ce3b129bbf
Co-Authored-By: xiexs <xiexs@cn.fujitsu.com>
blueprint: error-codes-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/06/293306/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Enhance error messages for API users ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/error-codes-support This spec is intended to enhance error message according to the guideline [1]. Formatted messages with better quality will help users and developer learn the API quickly. Consistent error messages cross services will make it possible that one service can transport error messages from dependent services to users. Problem description =================== Currently only limited information, such as 'code' and 'message', in the response message has been exposed to the users, while an error occurred. And it only bring few hints about the error to users so that it is not quite useful for users, if they want to figure out the root reason for that error. Furthermore, as the lack of unified format for the error message, it is hard to share the error message cross multiple projects while they are calling each other. Thus it is hard to support the cross-project tracking for the error. Use Cases ========= * Tom is a cloud administrator and he always wants to analyze the error message easily and finally resolve it as soon as possible, while an error encountered. So a detailed and helpful error message message will be a great assistant for him. * Tom also takes care multiple components about the cloud, e.g. cinder, keystone, and nova. So when a error is related to multiple components, there is a cross-project tracking will be a quite friendly feature for Tom. Proposed change =============== 1. Introduce a new class BaseErrorMeta. A new class BaseErrorMeta is introduced into cinder to collect information about problems encountered. According to the guideline [1], BaseErrorMeta class should contain the following attributes: * request_id: A unique identifier for the request. * code: A service-specific error code. * status: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem. * title: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. * detail: A human-readable explanation of the problem. * links: A set of links for more reference about this problem. For each error code we implement a subclass of BaseErrorMeta. A ErrorMeta should be identified by its error code, which is necessary for services like nova to distinguish "What happened?". 2. Add a wrapper Add a wrapper class around to the cinder API interfaces to add a list of BaseErrorMeta according to various real exceptions, and then re-raise the customised exception again in the wrapper. For more detailed information about the error and distinguish them from each other, hopefully, every error raised in the API interface should associate with a unique error code. By default, a common type of error code associated the API will be raised while there is no specific error code specified in the API interface. For example: .. code:: python + @error_code(code="volume.delete-failed-volume-not-found") def delete(...): ...code stuff... if not result: status = utils.build_or_str(expected.get('status'), _(' status must be %s and ')) msg = _('Volume%s must not be migrating, attached, belong to a ' LOG.info(msg) - raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) + raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg, + code='volume.delete-failed-volume-invalid-state') ...code stuff... try: self.key_manager.delete_key(context, encryption_key_id) except Exception as e: msg = _("Unable to delete encrypted volume: %s.") % e.msg - raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) + raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg, + code='olume.delete-failed-volume-been-encrypted') Note that if the exception contains a list of BaseErrorMeta, all of them should be included into the formatted message to re-raise together. 3. Enhance the wsgi interface The wsgi interface should be enhanced to support the output for the formatted error message. Note that for backward compatibility we have to differ the error message after formatted from the original ones with two different output formats respectively. What this specification does not solve -------------------------------------- * For a asynchronous operation which is supposed to return a 202 status code, if a success response is already returned, we don't have to generate BaseErrorMeta(s), since we can never return it to user. Alternatives ------------ None. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- * When error happens, a formatted error list is returned to API users, we need to start a new microversion as it breaks backward compatibility. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- * End user should realize the new error message format brought by this, and then be better to utilize them appropriately. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- * Developer should follow this error-code format when new API is introduced. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * (xiexs, xiexs@cn.fujitsu.com) * (Cao ShuFeng, caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com) Other contributors: * Anyone who wants to design the error-code and provide a help href link is welcome. Work Items ---------- * Introduce BaseErrorMeta into cinder * Introduce a wrapper into cinder * Add wrapper for all API * Add unittests and functional tests * Enhance API doc correspondingly Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Unit-tests should be implemented * Functional tests on python-cinderclient gates will be implemented Documentation Impact ==================== * The API doc needs to be updated. References ========== * [1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167793/ * [2]: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/error-codes-support

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer_api conditional

The conditional that requires the host to be in the
ceilometer_api group is removed. The ceilometer_api
group has been removed per https://review.openstack.org/#/c/437232/

Change-Id: Ie822987edfd3986125936781ce5da1c860ef1bba

commit_message:
GPFS Path: Fix bugs related to initialization of GPFS Driver

Due to lack of GPFS path ('/usr/lpp/mmfs/bin/') export, driver
is not able to find the GPFS commands causing the initialization
failure.
With this patch, GPFS will be able to run all GPFS commands
irrespective of GPFS path export.

Change-Id: I1aa8baf884dfaa42c37e575f0b6e1317f18543a1
Closes-bug: #1690785

subject: Use virtualenv for tests/charmhelpers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 03:17:21.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/amulet/utils.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/amulet/deployment.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/amulet/__init__.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/__init__.py', 'requirements.txt', 'bindep.txt', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/__init__.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/amulet/utils.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/__init__.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/amulet/deployment.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/amulet/__init__.py', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder/commit/3119bd55ec3c7fa7210a13ca73f4ff81ee9ca76b', 'message': 'Use virtualenv for tests/charmhelpers

Remove tests/charmhelpers from the repo and add charm-helpers to
test-requirements.txt.  Expect tests to succeed with the tip of
charmhelpers.  This has no effect on charmhelpers for hooks or
actions.

Add bindeps.txt to specify the bzr package requirement on test
runners, to support the bzr+lp: egg declaration format.

Move requirements.txt contents to test-requirements.txt and update
tox.ini to only use test-requirements.txt.

Many os-charm repos utilize both a requirements.txt file and a
test-requirements.txt file, while referencing both serially in all
tox test environments.  A single test-requirements.txt file should
be used instead.

Update requirements.txt with empty list and a comment for future
guidance to developers.

Update .gitignore for test result artifacts that may be created
in the checkout path.

Change-Id: I785c0aab0b5257fbb0645dc037257be88c41d244
'}]
commit_message:
Use virtualenv for tests/charmhelpers

Remove tests/charmhelpers from the repo and add charm-helpers to
test-requirements.txt.  Expect tests to succeed with the tip of
charmhelpers.  This has no effect on charmhelpers for hooks or
actions.

Add bindeps.txt to specify the bzr package requirement on test
runners, to support the bzr+lp: egg declaration format.

Move requirements.txt contents to test-requirements.txt and update
tox.ini to only use test-requirements.txt.

Many os-charm repos utilize both a requirements.txt file and a
test-requirements.txt file, while referencing both serially in all
tox test environments.  A single test-requirements.txt file should
be used instead.

Update requirements.txt with empty list and a comment for future
guidance to developers.

Update .gitignore for test result artifacts that may be created
in the checkout path.

Change-Id: I785c0aab0b5257fbb0645dc037257be88c41d244

added_lines: deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txtdeps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txtdeps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txtdeps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txtdeps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txtdeps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txtdeps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt [testenv:bindep] # Check for binary package dependencies, fail and alert on unmet requirements. # Does not attempt to install or resolve issues. deps = bindep commands = bindep test

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-27 14:23:04.000000000', 'files': ['tests/basic_deployment.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server/commit/7d8bb69dee55e60c38cdd9f0da7aae1501359389', 'message': "Update amulet test for beam process name with multiple cpus

The test infrastructure now presents test instances with more than
one cpu core, and the rabbitmq-server beam process name is 'beam.smp'
when that is the case.

Change-Id: I1ef6ebf4ed52ff593d6aa0359b7b2c1232c092f2
"}]
commit_message:
Update amulet test for beam process name with multiple cpus

The test infrastructure now presents test instances with more than
one cpu core, and the rabbitmq-server beam process name is 'beam.smp'
when that is the case.

Change-Id: I1ef6ebf4ed52ff593d6aa0359b7b2c1232c092f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server refs/changes/88/460588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Process is named 'beam' with 1 cpu; 'beam.smp' for >1 cpu. 'beam.smp': True,

commit_message:
Deprecate memcached_servers parameter

It is 'memcache_servers' in group [cache], not 'memcached_servers'.
For better understanding, deprecate memcached_servers option and
use memcahce_servers instead.

Change-Id: I57d7b45438904387176200c0062b7f33f4268006
Closes-Bug: #1690981

commit_message:
Correct hugepage percentage memory calculation

psutil.virtual_memory() returns values in bytes, not kilobytes.

Ensure 2MB hugepage size is calculated in the same units, ensuring
that % calculations are correct.

Resync of charmhelpers to fixup amulet test issues due to newer
client versions.

Change-Id: I95c431edcf316d194de752048ec1503d8fe996f1
Closes-Bug: 1678185

commit_message:
Delete a non-SLO object with ?multipart-manifest.

If ?multipart-manifest=delete is passed, but the object is not an
SLO, Swift currently returns a 400 error. This patch changes the
behavior to remove the object in this case and return the result to
the caller. This allows a consumer of the Swift API to remove all
objects in a given container without having to issue a HEAD request to
check whether an object is a regular object or an SLO.

Change-Id: Ic7cda27d6ecbe2bd0738937d7ba9ed7c8c3bd21e

commit_message:
Add retries for pcs cluster setup

In bug #1677312 we encountered an error where pcs cluster start --all
would return 1, due to pcsd on one node being in the middle of a restart
(due to ssl keys exchange).

It turns out this can also happen during the pcs cluster setup call, so
let's add the proper retries there as well. This has
been spotted a couple of time in largish clusters.

Closes-Bug: #1692923

Change-Id: Ia5d820c97d5dfdaaa03aff2721612937e0efa2e6

commit_message:
Correct the filter name for changes-since spec

There are some projects that support this filter:

changes-since: nova, glance(for api v2, it's only mentioned in spec)
changed-since: neutron

So for keeping consistent with most of projects, Cinder considers to
use changes-since and changes-before too.

Change-Id: Ie226e450ab6f2e246547a7ee7a179cad94d0018e

commit_message:
Use the list iterator instead of six iterator

We should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will be more readable.
In py2, the performance about list should be negligible

Change-Id: I111faa266a0fa98819d77a5dcdc9bb8c2def391a

commit_message:
Warn instead of fail with wrong type_driver

Some of us are using custom type_drivers. Puppet code should allow
unexpected values for type_drivers.

Change-Id: I4a308ad379dee61260e3d27da2da00d7fce14e56
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

commit_message:
Change CLI default API version

This adds a specification proposing bumping the default API version used
by ironic CLI and the baremetal OpenStack CLI plugin to the latest
available version. The client library is outside of the scope of this
spec.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <divius.inside@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I9e654b09af6f3594edc0ca8b5195517f9efe039c
Related-Bug: #1671145

commit_message:
VNX: allow specify pool name for replication

Currently, VNX driver will select a pool of same name as the
source volume when creating LUN replication. An error will occur if not
satisfied.
This patch will allow setting a different pool name for replication
target instead of using the pool of same name on the remote system.

DocImpact

Closes-bug: 1677561
Change-Id: Ia86c9a5c815c19d0096524b88d992d84266688f9
(cherry picked from commit 00b8a6ad2cc221869534116ded78c57e28b6c4d8)

commit_message:
Separate admin tests from test_routers

8 tests require admin credential on test_routers.
So this patch separates these tests from current test_routers and
moves them into admin path.

Change-Id: I86d382390d7e968a35e2454f36c6cc6052b176a6

commit_message:
Separate out routine for getting qemu_img_info

Without try...catch like fetch_to_volume_format,
fetch_verify_image will prevent a raw image from being used when qemu-img
is not installed.

So we add a try...catch for qemu_img_info for fetch_verify_image and
separate this into its own routine.

This fixes the failure if you create a volume with a raw, nonqemu image
and don't have the qemu packages on your system.

Change-Id: I3aaf43a453e7096161780d9bfc2515c66a3a9f2c
Closes-Bug: #1674771
(cherry picked from commit 70a0cc921f5fbbc7a6b59b4e3c87d3f24eb15c63)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/43/455543/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Merge test_update_server_name_in_stop_state

test_update_server_name_in_stop_state can be merged with
test_update_server_name, so we can save one create_server,
and the code logic is still clear enough.

test_update_server_name_in_stop_state is not used in defcore,
so it can be safely removed.

Change-Id: I687322e96d82c4c705b5654e9d1995234124d9f7

subject: Ensure tasks are not skipped
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-22 11:21:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/0c33635912f0e1ef20fef30e92624e53cedd6804', 'message': "Ensure tasks are not skipped

- The lookup of the first file found shouldn't be done:
  First, we should never skip: true, and always install a
  console/virt system, because we have set defaults
  Second, we can directly load the file without the fancy
  lookup, ansible should do the inclusion just fine.

- On the block/rescue: The rescue task didn't run, so if the when
  didn't trigger, no virt will be set, unless the
  ``cat /proc/cpuinfo`` failed.

Change-Id: I6e89de1c9d1828003a83c5ca2b5b56d64c12f30c
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-22 14:36:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/9cc0fe993c348c8c31ff72cffe7079a48a0bf228', 'message': "[WIP] Ensure tasks are not skipped

- The lookup of the first file found shouldn't be done:
  First, we should never skip: true, and always install a

commit_message:
Ensure tasks are not skipped

- The lookup of the first file should only be skipped
  when necessary (the apt bits).

- On the block/rescue: The rescue task didn't run, so if the when
  didn't trigger, no virt will be set, unless the
  ``cat /proc/cpuinfo`` failed.

Change-Id: I6e89de1c9d1828003a83c5ca2b5b56d64c12f30c

commit_message:
Source template files from git or deploy host

Instead of sourcing the paste/policy files from the role,
the deploy host will first be checked, then the git source.

The current mechanism uses a lookup, causing the fetch of
the default templates to happen via curl from the deployment
node. This causes problems if the deployment node does not
have access to the repo server web service, which may be the
case in high security environments.

This patch changes the mechanism to only use the lookup
module for the file content that is on the deployment node,
then falls back to using the uri module to fetch the default
content. This ensures that the deployment node does not have
to reach into the environment for the content.

The pattern applied is the same as that used in the
combination of the following two reference patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/446235
- https://review.openstack.org/463390

The rootwrap.conf template is re-added because it cannot be
used verbatim from the upstream repository. It requires the
addition of the service venv bin in the exec_dirs. A mechanism
to implement this dynamically will be figured out in a later
review along with an implementation which will fetch the
rootwrap files directly from the git source too.

Conflicts:
       defaults/main.yml
       tasks/ceilometer_post_install.yml

Change-Id: I248910a544f611b590bc93449aea98434802cae3
(cherry picked from commit 9e96b651260cd0d63babab9bbc685b3c329c7060)

commit_message:
Added option to enable_vpn

due to the fact that Neutron kicked out VPNaaS from governance.
We should disable vpn out of the box but give the option to deploy it.

REL.:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107384.html

Change-Id: Ieff504cdcd86bc31e8c3553b428968665259255f

commit_message:
fix stable branch membership detection

The rules for stable branch releases need to be relaxed a bit to account
for projects that are late to create their branches and only do so after
the default branch has been updated. This change makes the rules more
flexible so that it is possible to release for a stable branch on master
as long as that stable branch does not exist. The primary use for this
is to release and then create the stable branch in the same patch.

Change-Id: I2d8f9abcf8ffa34e29eb7021830fd635e6e0f85f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/29/466829/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _filter_branches(output): "Strip garbage from branch list output" return [ n for n in output.strip().split() if '/' in n or n == 'master' ] def check_branch_sha(workdir, repo, series, master, sha): """Check if the SHA is in the targeted branch. The SHA must appear on a stable/$series branch (if it exists) or master (if stable/$series does not exist). It is up to the reviewer to verify that releases from master are in a sensible location relative to other existing branches. We do not compare $series against the existing branches ordering because that would prevent us from retroactively creating a stable branch for a project after a later stable branch is created (i.e., if stable/N exists we could not create stable/N-1). """ try: containing_branches = _filter_branches( subprocess.check_output( ['git', 'branch', '-a', '--contains', sha], cwd=os.path.join(workdir, repo), ).decode('utf-8') ) # If the patch is on the named branch, everything is fine. if remote_match in containing_branches: return True # If the expected branch does not exist yet, this may be a # late release attempt to create that branch or just a project # that hasn't branched, yet, and is releasing from master for # that series. Allow the release, as long as it is on the # master branch. all_branches = _filter_branches( subprocess.check_output( ['git', 'branch', '-a'], cwd=os.path.join(workdir, repo), ).decode('utf-8') ) if (remote_match not in all_branches) and ('master' in containing_branches): return True # At this point we know the release is not from the required # branch and it is not from master, which means it is the # wrong branch and should not be allowed.
deleted_lines: def check_branch_sha(workdir, repo, series, master, sha): "Check if the SHA is in the targeted branch." if series == master: existing = get_branches(workdir, repo) if remote_match not in existing: # The stable branch for the series on master does not # exist in this repository, yet, so look for the commit on # the master branch. remote_match = 'master' try: output = subprocess.check_output( ['git', 'branch', '-a', '--contains', sha], cwd=os.path.join(workdir, repo), ).decode('utf-8').strip() for branch in output.split(): if branch == remote_match: return True

subject: NFS Backup: Fix overwritting backups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-18 08:39:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_posix.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/posix.py', 'releasenotes/notes/nfs_backup_no_overwrite-be7b545453baf7a3.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/535e71797031c3d3e3a5e2023c5ede470b02e3a7', 'message': 'NFS Backup: Fix overwritting backups

When using the NFS backup driver if we do multiple backups using the
same container we end up overwriting older backups.

The issue comes from a misunderstanding in the Posix backup driver of
the purpose of the "prefix" metadata used in the ChunkedBackupDriver
base class.

This prefix is for the name of the backup objects to store, but unlike
the prefix for the volumes, here it must be unique as the base driver
will only add numbers to identify the chunk (for the volume we add the
volume id).  Unfortunately the Posix driver just assumed that the prefix
had the same meaning as the prefix for volumes thus making one backups
override one another.

This patch changes the prefix generated by the Posix driver so we have
the following format: "volume_$VOL_ID_$TIMESTAMP_backup_$BACK_ID", thus
allowing multiple backups in the same container.

The new name is backward compatible with existing backups because the
new prefix will only be used on new backups as the prefix for already
existing backups is stored in the DB.

Change-Id: I2903c27633facde6370d95ba0b9e06025ccaef26
Closes-Bug: #1628768
'}]
commit_message:
NFS Backup: Fix overwritting backups

When using the NFS backup driver if we do multiple backups using the
same container we end up overwriting older backups.

The issue comes from a misunderstanding in the Posix backup driver of
the purpose of the "prefix" metadata used in the ChunkedBackupDriver
base class.

This prefix is for the name of the backup objects to store, but unlike
the prefix for the volumes, here it must be unique as the base driver
will only add numbers to identify the chunk (for the volume we add the
volume id).  Unfortunately the Posix driver just assumed that the prefix
had the same meaning as the prefix for volumes thus making one backups
override one another.

This patch changes the prefix generated by the Posix driver so we have
the following format: "volume_$VOL_ID_$TIMESTAMP_backup_$BACK_ID", thus
allowing multiple backups in the same container.

The new name is backward compatible with existing backups because the
new prefix will only be used on new backups as the prefix for already
existing backups is stored in the DB.

Change-Id: I2903c27633facde6370d95ba0b9e06025ccaef26
Closes-Bug: #1628768
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/69/465869/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fix NFS backup driver, we now support multiple backups on the same container, they are no longer overwritten.

commit_message:
Get Cell UUID based on Cell name variable

In I751ea370819379687b04f06e71afa68579bcbc69 we added steps to check for
cell1 UUID and then map instances accordingly. We should do this based
on the name variable and not a forced "cell1" value.

Change-Id: Iee6d6a80fa487ea00055edaef389047d80687c06
(cherry picked from commit 33bd2fd85402dfcd8862fb0434aeb7a0b06e9374)

subject: Increase swap size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 11:22:35.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/06c2b1389ae85cba388ef58c03ee8ab2a73de363', 'message': "Increase swap size

While testing incoming release of eventlet 0.20.1 we've
discovered that it's increasing memory usage for processes
using eventlet. It has been reported upstream [1] but
aparently this is expected.

p-o-i scenario003 is pretty heavy in terms of memory. Before new
eventlet version it's already using ~700-800MB swap in my tests and
with new eventlet (not pushed to RDO Testing repo yet) it has failed
with out-of-memory problems from time to time.

With this patch, i'm increasing swap size from 2GB to 4GB to avoid
oom problems. Note that this may derive in performance issues if
we start having too much swap usage, but i haven't hit it in my
local tests.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/412

Change-Id: If333ae62dbae3f597d2b14ae1dd4c174ecdf51fc
"}]
commit_message:
Increase swap size

While testing incoming release of eventlet 0.20.1 we've
discovered that it's increasing memory usage for processes
using eventlet. It has been reported upstream [1] but
aparently this is expected.

p-o-i scenario003 is pretty heavy in terms of memory. Before new
eventlet version it's already using ~700-800MB swap in my tests and
with new eventlet (not pushed to RDO Testing repo yet) it has failed
with out-of-memory problems from time to time.

With this patch, i'm increasing swap size from 2GB to 4GB to avoid
oom problems. Note that this may derive in performance issues if
we start having too much swap usage, but i haven't hit it in my
local tests.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/412

Change-Id: If333ae62dbae3f597d2b14ae1dd4c174ecdf51fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/29/467129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: nova: use default value for $vncserver_listen
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-12 12:50:00.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/nova.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/feb5de1ad92013a1f123bd5b358d190167ee5a28', 'message': "nova: use default value for $vncserver_listen

Instead of overriding nova::compute::libvirt::vncserver_listen, just use
the default value, so we can check that nova-compute will bind the
process on 127.0.0.1 and not 0.0.0.0.

It's recommanded for security to use an host IP address, instead of
0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I724e8485d9fa58c213606ef0b30e2483d8a04802
"}]
commit_message:
nova: use default value for $vncserver_listen

Instead of overriding nova::compute::libvirt::vncserver_listen, just use
the default value, so we can check that nova-compute will bind the
process on 127.0.0.1 and not 0.0.0.0.

It's recommanded for security to use an host IP address, instead of
0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I724e8485d9fa58c213606ef0b30e2483d8a04802

commit_message:
rehome utils: synchronized decorator and load_class_by_alias_or_classname

This patch rehomes the neutron common utils:
- load_class_by_alias_or_classname() function.
- synchronized decorator.

These utils are used by subprojects [1] and will
also be used as part of rehoming the logic in neutron's
manager module.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=load_class_by_alias_or_classname

Change-Id: I62958e30695663797d79ed6bd1260edbb46a1bf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/64/453264/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - The ``load_class_by_alias_or_classname`` function from ``neutron.common.utils`` is now available in ``neutron_lib.utils.runtime``. - The ``synchronized`` decorator from ``neutron.common.utils`` is now available in ``neutron_lib.utils.runtime``.

commit_message:
Support os_version, os_type, and os_distro image properties

Modified default images to use os_type, os_version and os_distro
properties.  Added logic to look for distribution/os_distro,
type/os_type and version/os_version image properties when
matching image properties.

Cleaned up minor python warnings in tosca_compute.py

Removed DOS-style newline characters from
tosca_cluster_policies_scaling.py

Change-Id: I72043cf4a4358cfdbc8f98238276d85dc2f5bcc0
Closes-Bug: 1689673

added_lines: """Translate TOSCA node type tosca.nodes.Compute.""" IMAGE_OS_PROP = (OS_DISTRO, OS_VERSION) = ('os_distro', 'os_version') [self.ARCHITECTURE], architecture) image_type = properties.get(self.TYPE) if image_type is None: match_type = self._match_images(match_arch, images, [self.TYPE], image_type) [self.DISTRIBUTION, self.OS_DISTRO], [self.VERSION, self.OS_VERSION], version) @staticmethod def _match_flavors(this_list, this_dict, attr, size): """Return from this list all flavors matching the attribute size.""" @staticmethod def _least_flavor(this_list, this_dict, attr): """Return from this list the flavor with the smallest attr.""" @staticmethod def _match_images(this_list, this_dict, attr_list, prop): for attr in attr_list: if attr in this_dict[image]: if this_dict[image][attr].lower() == str(prop).lower(): matching_images.insert(0, image) else: matching_images.append(image) @staticmethod def _log_compute_msg(prop, what): log.warning(msg)
deleted_lines: '''Translate TOSCA node type tosca.nodes.Compute.''' self.ARCHITECTURE, architecture) type = properties.get(self.TYPE) if type is None: match_type = self._match_images(match_arch, images, self.TYPE, type) self.DISTRIBUTION, self.VERSION, version) def _match_flavors(self, this_list, this_dict, attr, size): '''Return from this list all flavors matching the attribute size.''' def _least_flavor(self, this_list, this_dict, attr): '''Return from this list the flavor with the smallest attr.''' def _match_images(self, this_list, this_dict, attr, prop): if attr in this_dict[image]: if this_dict[image][attr].lower() == str(prop).lower(): matching_images.insert(0, image) else: matching_images.append(image) def _log_compute_msg(self, prop, what): log.warn(msg)

commit_message:
Replaces neutronclient's initialisation with keystoneauth

Uses keystoneauth1 to initialise the neutronclient instead of
passing in all credentials.

Change-Id: Ifcce176205240a1fe9d723886d5a640b4ba694a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/87/464587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneauth1 import loading as ks_loading session = ks_loading.load_session_from_conf_options( CONF, config.NEUTRON_GROUP) auth_plugin = ks_loading.load_auth_from_conf_options( CONF, config.NEUTRON_GROUP) self._client = clientv20.Client( session=session, auth=auth_plugin, endpoint_override=CONF.neutron.url)
deleted_lines: params = { 'endpoint_url': CONF.neutron.url, 'timeout': CONF.neutron.url_timeout, 'insecure': True, 'ca_cert': None, 'username': CONF.neutron.admin_username, 'tenant_name': CONF.neutron.admin_tenant_name, 'password': CONF.neutron.admin_password, 'auth_url': CONF.neutron.admin_auth_url, 'auth_strategy': CONF.neutron.auth_strategy } self._client = clientv20.Client(**params)

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-quota-sets endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds os-quota-sets related routes by a plain list, instead
of using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves to the
plain routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading will be
removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I2b9b3f2acef09e553245ce6ebac18f26269d81d0

commit_message:
Replace pycrypto with cryptography

The pycrypto library is unmaintained, and keystonemiddleware currently
uses pycrypto to encrypt and decrpyt things before caching them.
This patch set removes the pycrypto dependency and updates the code
to use the cryptography library.  See [1].  Replacing the cryptographic
library is backward compatible.  See [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568.html
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/610186/

Change-Id: Iced7f5115e49ccf4f7f5bf6813cb5988b95c248b
Closes-Bug: #1677308
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/41/451941/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cryptography.hazmat.backends import default_backend from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers import algorithms from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers import Cipher from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.ciphers import modesdef assert_crypto_availability(f): cipher = Cipher(algorithms.AES(key), modes.CBC(iv), backend=default_backend()) padded_data = data + six.int2byte(padding) * padding encryptor = cipher.encryptor() return iv + encryptor.update(padded_data) + encryptor.finalize() backend = default_backend() cipher = Cipher(algorithms.AES(key), modes.CBC(iv), backend=backend) try: decryptor = cipher.decryptor() result = decryptor.update(data[16:]) + decryptor.finalize()
deleted_lines: Data should be serialized before entering these functions. Encryption has a dependency on the pycrypto. If pycrypto is not available, CryptoUnavailableError will be raised. # make sure pycrypto is available try: from Crypto.Cipher import AES except ImportError: AES = Noneclass CryptoUnavailableError(Exception): """raise when Python Crypto module is not available.""" pass def assert_crypto_availability(f): """Ensure Crypto module is available.""" if AES is None: raise CryptoUnavailableError() cipher = AES.new(key, AES.MODE_CBC, iv) return iv + cipher.encrypt(data + six.int2byte(padding) * padding) cipher = AES.new(key, AES.MODE_CBC, iv) try: result = cipher.decrypt(data[16:])

Remove oslotest from test-requirements

It is not needed and stevedore is a fundamental package which should
try to keep its requirements list small.

commit_message:
Fixes Windows Server 2016 Network Controller constants

In order to properly use the Windows Server 2016 Network Controller,
a switch port must have set a port profile with some very specific
constants, otherwise it won't work. [1]

[1] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/networking/sdn/manage/create-a-tenant-vm

Change-Id: Ic3788ed8945e337ab9bd345731be8792c0d346b7
Partially-Implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/29/466029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Windows Server 2016 Network Controller related constants. # NOTE(claudiub): These constants HAVE to be defined exactly like this, # otherwise networking using the Windows Server 2016 Network Controller won't # work. # https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/networking/sdn/manage/create-a-tenant-vm # noqa NET_CFG_INSTANCE_ID = "{56785678-a0e5-4a26-bc9b-c0cba27311a3}" CDN_LABEL_STRING = "TestCdn"PROFILE_NAME = "Testprofile" VENDOR_ID = "{1FA41B39-B444-4E43-B35A-E1F7985FD548}"

commit_message:
docker/TLS-everywhere: Add metadata_settings output to templates

This is needed since it's what writes the service metadata to the nova
server in order to create the kerberos principals. It worked in a base
controller since the keystone template does have this. But if we would
deploy these services on a separate role, it would break. So this output
is needed.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Change-Id: I3ee8c65d356dcd092a3fbf79041e5c69ef23b721

commit_message:
Improve leapfrog pluggability

The leapfrog is quite static, and a deployer can only run
scripts before and after the process.

By adding this, a deployer can alter the re-deploy behavior.
It can now run playbooks or shell scripts after the migrations,
and modify the re-deploy behavior (by adding more playbooks for
example).

Change-Id: Idde1e94d014fe4ca527568641a04c847a710d801

commit_message:
Fix get_compute_usage normalization problem

When we normalize an empty usage report, start and end can be empty, so
the pop() call fails. Don't fail on that.

Also, stop forcing interface=admin in operator_cloud. We stopped adding
 this elsewhere already, because it turns out it's NOT actually a thing
 anyone should ever do by default. (It's an old keystone v2 thing -
jamielennox says it should be avoided like the plague) Make
operator_cloud consistent. (This will still honor interface=admin if
it's in the clouds.yaml file)

Change-Id: I432dc58d60fb56ce13332443435138354d66e9e1

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: nova-install and nova-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Change-Id: I1f9b203dfe17d65b8b90eb6079bd07b7686c94ab

commit_message:
Add neutron-vpnaas in-tree documentation

One of the requirements[1] for Neutron stadium projects is to have
in-tree developer documentation.  This creates a stub for that.  We can
expand on it once the stub is in, but this will permit us to set up
publishing while we iterate on it.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/stadium/governance.html#checklist

Depends-on: Id5650a6b4cebb65d964610cde3d4685d242007d7
Change-Id: I04a10f375691c0388632db1596b089fa7620d7c1

commit_message:
Validation before perform node deallocation

Introduces a new validation to ensure the node deallocation
process will only be performed to nodes that have Server
Profile applied in OneView. When the allocation process
fails, the machine will have no Server Profile applied in
OneView and in ironic it will have no reference to any
Server Profile. Under these conditions if the deallocation
process be performed the driver will try to delete a
nonexistent Server Profile in OneView, leaving the node
in error state in ironic.

Change-Id: I83cef7fafac4e22ebf5eb4fe83f6da26ec132c99
Closes-Bug: #1657892
(cherry picked from commit 0b23a041f1111ad112d28619fa020173805edbbe)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/25/459325/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sp_uri = '/rest/server-profiles/1234556789' ov_client = mock_get_ov_client() fake_sh = oneview_models.ServerHardware() fake_sh.server_profile_uri = sp_uri ov_client = mock_get_ov_client.return_value ov_client.get_server_hardware_by_uuid.return_value = fake_sh deploy_utils.tear_down(ov_client, task) ov_client.delete_server_profile.called sp_uri = '/rest/server-profiles/1234556789' ov_client = mock_get_ov_client() fake_sh = oneview_models.ServerHardware() fake_sh.server_profile_uri = sp_uri ov_client = mock_get_ov_client.return_value ov_client.get_server_hardware_by_uuid.return_value = fake_sh deploy_utils.tear_down_cleaning(ov_client, task) self.assertTrue(ov_client.delete_server_profile.called) @mock.patch.object(objects.Node, 'save') def test_deallocate_server_hardware_from_ironic_missing_profile_uuid( self, mock_node_save, mock_get_ov_client ): """Test for case when server profile application fails. Due to an error when applying Server Profile in OneView, the node will have no Server Profile uuid in the 'applied_server_profile_uri' namespace. When the method tested is called without Server Profile uuid, the client will raise a ValueError when trying to delete the profile, this error is converted to an OneViewError. """ ov_client = mock_get_ov_client.return_value fake_sh = oneview_models.ServerHardware() fake_sh.server_profile_uri = 'any/applied_sp_uri/' ov_client.get_server_hardware_by_uuid.return_value = fake_sh ov_client.delete_server_profile.side_effect = ValueError mock_get_ov_client.return_value = ov_client with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid) as task: driver_info = task.node.driver_info driver_info['applied_server_profile_uri'] = 'any/applied_sp_uri/' task.node.driver_info = driver_info self.assertRaises( exception.OneViewError, deploy_utils.deallocate_server_hardware_from_ironic, ov_client, task.node ) self.assertTrue(ov_client.delete_server_profile.called) self.assertTrue( 'applied_server_profile_uri' in task.node.driver_info )
deleted_lines: oneview_client = mock_get_ov_client() deploy_utils.tear_down(oneview_client, task) oneview_client.delete_server_profile.called oneview_client = mock_get_ov_client() deploy_utils.tear_down_cleaning(oneview_client, task) self.assertTrue(oneview_client.delete_server_profile.called)

commit_message:
Dummy patch to build a new rpm in RDO

The version of openstack-tripleo-image-elements in RDO for stable
branches is too old and it might be one of the reasons why TripleO CI is
failing to deploy TripleO on Newton.

See: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690373

This patch is doing nothing important but by merging it, we'll build a
new package in RDO for master and all branches and hopefully get a new
build that will help us to resolve the issue.

Change-Id: Ie6c21aa8d071e791eb0df6db6d700074d3141cf0
Related-Bug: #1690373
(cherry picked from commit cc32f26871484a77b56582a546b3a84cfba586bd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/35/465935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Dummy patch to build a new rpm in RDO

The version of openstack-tripleo-image-elements in RDO for stable
branches is too old and it might be one of the reasons why TripleO CI is
failing to deploy TripleO on Newton.

See: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690373

This patch is doing nothing important but by merging it, we'll build a
new package in RDO for master and all branches and hopefully get a new
build that will help us to resolve the issue.

Change-Id: Ie6c21aa8d071e791eb0df6db6d700074d3141cf0
Related-Bug: #1690373
(cherry picked from commit cc32f26871484a77b56582a546b3a84cfba586bd)

commit_message:
Use provided unit scope in db_changed

If the unit parameter is passed to the db_changed function, ensure
that its used instead of the remote_unit function so that db_changed
can be called outside of the db-relation-changed hook context.

Change-Id: I30b42522ed982213176e485a1140ed872fc571df
Closes-Bug: 1688401
(cherry picked from commit 11bfc1e529d93cd06f15745413578a38c464f1a2)

commit_message:
Get Cell UUID based on Cell name variable

In I751ea370819379687b04f06e71afa68579bcbc69 we added steps to check for
cell1 UUID and then map instances accordingly. We should do this based
on the name variable and not a forced "cell1" value.

Change-Id: Iee6d6a80fa487ea00055edaef389047d80687c06
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/88/467088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shell: "{{ nova_bin }}/nova-manage --config-file /etc/nova/nova.conf cell_v2 list_cells | awk '/{{ nova_cell1_name }}/ {print $4}'"

commit_message:
Remove Certificate Orders and CAs from Documentation

Removes the documentation and links to domcumentation for
Certificate Orders and CAs.

Change-Id: I4cd3c21ac4f82eeb76d700426374cec898be4125
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/68/462368/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: **************************************** Certificates Authorities API - Reference **************************************** .. warning:: DEPRECATION WARNING: The Certificates Authorities API has been deprecated and will be removed in the P release. Barbican provides an API to interact with certificate authorities (CAs). For an introduction to CAs and how Barbican manages them, see the `Certificate Authorities User's Guide <http://developer.openstack.org/api-guide/key-manager/cas.html>`__. Understanding the following concepts, explained in the user's guide, is important to understanding how to use this API. - Certificate Authorities - Subordinate Certificate Authorities - Project CAs - Preferred CAs - Global Preferred CAs This document will focus on the details of the Barbican /v1/cas REST API. GET /v1/cas ########### Any user can request a list of CAs that may be used. Depending on the settings for the user's project, the returned list may be filtered. If a project has project CAs configured, the list will only contain only the project CAs and the subordinate CAs for that project. If not, it will contain all of the configured CAs and none of the subordinate CAs owned by other projects. .. _get_cas_request_response: Request/Response: ***************** .. code-block:: javascript Request: GET /v1/cas Headers: X-Auth-Token:<token> Accept: application/json Response: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json {"cas": ["http://localhost:9311/v1/cas/9277c4b4-2c7a-4612-a693-1e738a83eb54", "http://localhost:9311/v1/cas/d9e853eb-aea4-4002-9be7-78665062f393"], "total": 2} .. _get_cas_parameters: Parameters ********** +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +==============+=========+================================================================+ | offset | integer | The starting index within the total list of the project | | | | CAs that you would like to receive. | +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | limit | integer | The maximum number of records to return. | +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | plugin_name | string | Filter the returned list of CAs based on plugin name | +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | plugin_id | string | Filter the returned list of CAs based on plugin id | +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ .. _get_cas_response_attributes: Response Attributes ******************* +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +================+=========+==============================================================+ | cas | list | A list of CA references | +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | total | integer | The total number of configured project CAs records. | +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | next | string | A HATEOAS url to retrieve the next set of CAs based on | | | | the offset and limit parameters. This attribute is only | | | | available when the total number of secrets is greater than | | | | offset and limit parameter combined. | +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | previous | string | A HATEOAS url to retrieve the previous set of CAs based | | | | on the offset and limit parameters. This attribute is only | | | | available when the request offset is greater than 0. | +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ .. _get_cas_status_codes: HTTP Status Codes ***************** +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Code | Description | +======+=============================================================================+ | 200 | Successful Request | +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 401 | Authentication error. Missing or invalid X-Auth-Token. | +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 403 | The user was authenticated, but is not authorized to perform this action | +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ GET /v1/cas/all ############### A project admin can request a list of CAs that may be used. This returned list will include root certificates, as well as CAs assigned to the project and subCAs created for this project. This will allow a project admin to find all CAs that his project could have access to, so he can manage his project CA list. .. _get_cas_all_request_response: Request/Response: ***************** .. code-block:: javascript Request: GET /v1/cas/all Headers: X-Auth-Token:<token> Accept: application/json Response: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json {"cas": ["http://localhost:9311/v1/cas/9277c4b4-2c7a-4612-a693-1e738a83eb54", "http://localhost:9311/v1/cas/d9e853eb-aea4-4002-9be7-78665062f393"], "total": 2} .. _get_cas_all_parameters: Parameters ********** +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +==============+=========+================================================================+ | offset | integer | The starting index within the total list of the project | | | | CAs that you would like to receive. | +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | limit | integer | The maximum number of records to return. | +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | plugin_name | string | Filter the returned list of CAs based on plugin name | +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | plugin_id | string | Filter the returned list of CAs based on plugin id | +--------------+---------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ .. _get_cas_all_response_attributes: Response Attributes ******************* +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Type | Description | +================+=========+==============================================================+ | cas | list | A list of CA references | +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | total | integer | The total number of configured project CAs records. | +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | next | string | A HATEOAS url to retrieve the next set of CAs based on | | | | the offset and limit parameters. This attribute is only | | | | available when the total number of secrets is greater than | | | | offset and limit parameter combined. | +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ | previous | string | A HATEOAS url to retrieve the previous set of CAs based | | | | on the offset and limit parameters. This attribute is only | | | | available when the request offset is greater than 0. | +----------------+---------+--------------------------------------------------------------+ .. _get_cas_all_status_codes: HTTP Status Codes ***************** +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Code | Description | +======+=============================================================================+ | 200 | Successful Request | +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 401 | Authentication error. Missing or invalid X-Auth-Token. | +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | 403 | The user was authenticated, but is not authorized to perform this action | +------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+ GET /v1/cas/{CA_ID} ################### Any user can request details about a CA to which he has permissions. .. _get_cas_caid_request_response: Request/Response: ***************** .. code-block:: javascript Request: GET /v1/cas/9277c4b4-2c7a-4612-a693-1e738a83eb54 Headers: X-Auth-Token:<token>
